channel.title: (Still cant figure it out)Making a Object give a random item from a list
channel.description: I was wondering how i would make a object give a person a random item when used. Can anyone point me in the right direction i know i need to edit the Item/Item2.Java and the Client.java more specificly "public void objectClick"

item.title: (Still cant figure it out)Making a Object give a random item from a list

item.title: (Still cant figure it out)Making a Object give a random item from a list
item.dc:creator: @wat72 wat72
item.description:
@wat72 wrote:

[quote=“Jeremy368, post:8, topic:263006”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=347428.msg2674869#msg2674869 date=1235007130]
You need to use randomMagicStall as the argument.
Or just use misc.random alone to get the result.

addItem(554 + misc.random(12), 1);

[/quote]
What is the 12 for??? god i feel like such a nub… i have been at this for over an hour and i cant get the damn thing to work no matter how i word it…

i want to use the “use randomMagicStall as the argument.” but i cant get it working

OMFG NOTHING WORKS i feel like i should just give up… I have been fu**ing with these few letter for over an hour now and i STILL cant get it working… really pissing me off[/quote]It adds a random number from 1 to 12 to the integer (the id of the item).

Read full topic

item.title: (Still cant figure it out)Making a Object give a random item from a list
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Jeremy368, post:8, topic:263006”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=347428.msg2674869#msg2674869 date=1235007130]
You need to use randomMagicStall as the argument.
Or just use misc.random alone to get the result.

addItem(554 + misc.random(12), 1);

[/quote]
What is the 12 for??? god i feel like such a nub… i have been at this for over an hour and i cant get the damn thing to work no matter how i word it…

i want to use the “use randomMagicStall as the argument.” but i cant get it working

OMFG NOTHING WORKS i feel like i should just give up… I have been fu**ing with these few letter for over an hour now and i STILL cant get it working… really pissing me off[/quote]
Mine is simpler than the way you wanted to do it and will do the exact same thing.
It will give you an item with an id between 554 and 566.

Read full topic

item.title: (Still cant figure it out)Making a Object give a random item from a list
item.dc:creator: @i_nelson_i i nelson i
item.description:
@i_nelson_i wrote:

[quote=“Jeremy368, post:22, topic:263006”][quote author=i nelson i link=topic=347428.msg2675020#msg2675020 date=1235014922]
here add somet like this

in client.java in object click

if (objectID == xxxx) { addItem(Item.randomrandom(), 1); sM("text here!"); }
replace xxxx wid object id

add this in item.java

[code] public static int random[] = {xxxx, xxxx. xxxx};

    public static int random()
    {
        return random[(int)(Math.random()*random.length)];
    }[/code]

replace xxxx wid ids
[/quote]
Honestly I had been messing with it for hours. For like the first time ever I almost just asked someone to just give me the code. I had tried everything i could think of and i didnt even know what to try. I think you can help someone only up to a certain extent and then you might as well just tell them exactly what you mean.

Thank you all for helping as i was to the point of just giving up with this one little line of code…[/quote]

hmm what do u meen, i understand half of it…:s

Read full topic

[quote=“i nelson i, post:12, topic:263006”]here add somet like this

in client.java in object click

if (objectID == xxxx) { addItem(Item.randomrandom(), 1); sM("text here!"); }
replace xxxx wid object id

add this in item.java

[code] public static int random[] = {xxxx, xxxx. xxxx};

    public static int random()
    {
        return random[(int)(Math.random()*random.length)];
    }[/code]

replace xxxx wid ids[/quote]
Honestly I had been messing with it for hours. For like the first time ever I almost just asked someone to just give me the code. I had tried everything i could think of and i didnt even know what to try. I think you can help someone only up to a certain extent and then you might as well just tell them exactly what you mean.

Thank you all for helping as i was to the point of just giving up with this one little line of code…

item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

This is the code i am using:

case 4877: //Magic Stall addItem(misc.random(MagicStall)); break;
This is the error:

client.java:2096: cannot find symbol symbol : variable MagicStall location: class client addItem(misc.random(MagicStall)); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
so i assume i have a problem with this code:

[code] public static int MagicStall[] = { 554, 555, 556, 557, 558, 559, 560, 562, 563, 564, 565, 566};

public static int randomMagicStall() {
    return MagicStall[(int) (Math.random() * MagicStall.length)];
}[/code]

Need Help Badly
